page.title: 20Transport, New Galloway
page.content: Due to New Galloway's rural setting, car ownership is really considered essential.The Postal Service bus, which runs twice daily, carries few passengers, and, these are, generally, the older inhabitants. The nearest Railway station is at Dumfries, 30Kms.S., or at Ayr,35Kms.N. The nearest sea port is at Stranraer,80Kms.W. where a ferry runs to Larne, Ireland. For other sailings, one has to use an English sea port or go to Ardrossan in Strathclyde. The nearest airport is at Prestwick,3Kms. N. of Ayr. There are 4 exits from New Galloway.-A712,A75W. to Stranraer; A762,A713N.to Ayr or A713S.to Castle Douglas;A762S.to Laurieston.One may then go S. to Kirkcudbright,E. to Castle Douglas,or W.to Gatehouse-of- Fleet. The roads are all well-surfaced but twisting,and caution is advised.
